rOlive.name: Russian Olive
facts: The Russian olive's scientific name is Elaeagnus Angustifolia.
The Russian olive is in 38 out of 50 US states.
Russian olive trees reach their maximum height of 35 feet in less than 20 years.
Russian olives are producers.
Russian olives convert energy from the sun through a process called photosynthesis.
Birds eat the olives of the Russian olive tree.
The Russian olive threatens native plant life by taking over their land area.

rKnapweed.name: Russian Knapweed
facts: The Russian knapweed's scientific name is Rhaponticum Repens
Russian knapweeds are toxic to livestock causing them to not be eaten by animals.
The Russian knapweed are able to survive in different types of soil.
Russian knapweeds can grow to 35 inches.
The Russian knapweeds were introduced to the United States in the early 1900s.
Russian knapweeds are producers.
Russian knapweeds convert energy from the sun through a process called photosynthesis.
The presence of the Russian knapweed can reduce wildlife population.

thistle.name: Thistle
facts: The thistle's scientific name is Cirsium Mill.
Thistles are part of the daisy family.
The thistle is in every US State.
Thistles are producers.
Thistles convert energy from the sun through a process called photosynthesis.
Thistles are only eaten by animals who can eat things with thorns like alpacas and horses.
When introduced to an area, the thistle can kill off many native plants.
